required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stroke Ready - Optimizing Acute Stroke Care
clinical_study.official_title: Stroke Ready - Optimizing Acute Stroke Care

collaborator.agency: National Institute on Minority Health and Health Disparities (NIMHD)

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to increase acute stroke treatment rates in Flint, Michigan through a two-pronged approach of hospital and community level interventions. It also aims to inform future stroke preparedness interventions by exploring the relative importance of hospital optimization and community interventions.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Stroke Ready is a stepped wedge design to be delivered to each of the four Flint community quadrants over the course of 2 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Acute stroke treatment rate (tPA and endovascular treatment)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time frame: 11 years of data will be reviewed
primary_outcome.description: Acute stroke treatment rate - community wide. Retrospective data captured through medical record review

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of emergency department arrivals by ambulance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time frame: 11 years of data will be reviewed
secondary_outcome.description: Optimize community for acute stroke (community level)--retrospective data captured through medical record review

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time frame: 11 years of data will be reviewed
secondary_outcome.description: Acute stroke treatment rate - community wide. Retrospective data captured through medical record review

arm_group.description: We divided the Flint community into four quadrants. We will focus our workshops and posters on one quadrant, but not exclusively, moving quadrants every 6 months over the course of two years.

intervention.description: Stroke Ready community intervention consists of peer facilitated educational workshops, stroke music video, and mass media campaign including print materials (e.g. posters, brochure), health promotion mailers, radio/Television public health service announcements, and the Stroke Ready website and Facebook page.

criteria.textblock: Inclusion criteria:Adult stroke patients who presented to one of three hospitals in the Flint community.
